meanings.definition: A wild cat native to the Americas, known for its distinctive markings and nocturnal habits.
meanings.sent1: Ocelots are skilled hunters in the dark of night.
meanings.sent2: We saw a group of ocelots roaming the jungle.
meanings.sent3: The ocelots decided to have a midnight party in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes gleamed like those of an ocelot on the prowl.
meanings.sent5: The ocelots' fur shimmered under the moonlight, a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The plural form of ocelot, referring to more than one of these animals.
meanings.sent1: Many ocelots gathered near the riverbank.
meanings.sent2: The zoo welcomed a new exhibit featuring ocelots.
meanings.sent3: The ocelots threw a surprise birthday party for their friend.
meanings.sent4: The forest echoed with the calls of the ocelots.
meanings.sent5: A family of ocelots played together in the lush greenery.
